text: Hey folks, I am just starting to use vscode, never really used it before. But I was wondering if there is a way to have the julia extension automatically include the `end` keyword when I write the word `function` . It seems like such an obvious thing that perhaps someone has already implemented it. Or perhaps I need to just create a new snippet?

elements.text: Hey folks, I am just starting to use vscode, never really used it before. But I was wondering if there is a way to have the julia extension automatically include the
keyword when I write the word
. It seems like such an obvious thing that perhaps someone has already implemented it. Or perhaps I need to just create a new snippet?

text: for me this does work btw. i type function, then `enter` and the template shows up with the cursor after `function`

elements.text: for me this does work btw. i type function, then
and the template shows up with the cursor after

text: hmm, I wonder if there is some setting that I have left unchecked or something.

elements.text: hmm, I wonder if there is some setting that I have left unchecked or something.

text: Oh I see, haha. I was not clicking enter on the completion. That was the issue. Now when I do that, it works. Haha, Thanks <@UM8JUNJG7>. It works now.

elements.text: Oh I see, haha. I was not clicking enter on the completion. That was the issue. Now when I do that, it works. Haha, Thanks
